item.title: 'Delayed projects by 35-40 years': PM Modi's sharp attack on Congress - The Times of India
item.description:
PM Modi's Sharp Attack on Congress Regarding Project Delays

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

This article covers Prime Minister Modi's recent criticism of the Congress party, highlighting claims of project delays spanning 35-40 years and the implications for development.

  • PM Modi points to significant delays in key projects attributed to Congress governance.
  • The Prime Minister emphasizes the urgency of completing ongoing infrastructure projects.
  • This critique comes amidst the backdrop of upcoming elections, focusing on accountability.
"The delays have cost our nation dearly, and it's time for accountability."

In conclusion, Modi's statements reflect broader campaign strategies aimed at demonstrating progress and responsibility as the elections approach.

item.title: Engineering student sexually assaulted by 2 men on Chennai's Anna University campus - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Chennai sexual assault: The survivor is a second-year engineering student who lives in a hostel on the campus.

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A second-year engineering student was sexually assaulted on the campus of Anna University in Chennai during the early hours of Wednesday. The assailants attacked her male friend before dragging her into the bushes.

  • The assault occurred inside the university campus.
  • Police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the attackers.
  • The survivor is a hostel resident at the university.
  • Leaders from political parties condemned the incident, highlighting issues of safety for women in Tamil Nadu.
“shameful” - Edappadi K Palaniswami, Leader of Opposition

This incident has drawn attention to significant concerns regarding women's safety in educational institutions in India, prompting widespread condemnation and calls for action.

item.title: 'BJP is rattled': Kejriwal's response on row over AAP's welfare schemes - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal responds to BJP's concerns over AAP's welfare schemes

Publication Date: October 24, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Arvind Kejriwal, Chief Minister of Delhi and leader of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), has responded to the BJP's criticisms regarding AAP's welfare initiatives, asserting that these schemes are essential for the public's well-being.

  • Kejriwal emphasizes that AAP's welfare schemes are aimed at improving the lives of Delhi residents.
  • The BJP has raised questions about the funding and implementation of these welfare initiatives.
  • Kejriwal argues that the initiatives have received significant public support and have made a positive impact.
“Our focus remains on the welfare of the citizens of Delhi. The opposition can criticize, but we will continue our work for the people.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The debate surrounding the welfare schemes highlights the ongoing political rivalry between AAP and BJP, with both parties presenting contrasting views on governance and public welfare.

item.title: India to commission 2 frontline warships & a sub in New Year in big boost to blue-water capabilities - The Times of India
item.description:
India to Commission 2 Frontline Warships & a Submarine in New Year to Enhance Blue-Water Capabilities

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses India's plans to enhance its naval capabilities by commissioning two frontline warships and a submarine in the upcoming New Year, marking a significant step towards improving its blue-water capabilities.

  • The commissioning is scheduled for early January 2024.
  • The warships will be equipped with advanced technology to boost India's maritime defense.
  • This move is part of a broader strategy to strengthen naval presence and security in the Indian Ocean region.
“This investment reflects India's commitment to ensuring maritime security and maintaining regional stability.”

The commissioning of new naval assets represents a vital enhancement in India's defense posture, aiming to solidify its position as a key player in regional security dynamics.

item.title: Road named after Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah in Mysuru, Opposition slams civic body - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Controversy Arises as Road Named After Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah in Mysuru

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Mysuru City Corporation's proposal to rename a road after Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has sparked controversy, with the Opposition criticizing the decision as a betrayal to the people of Karnataka.

  • The proposed name for the road is Siddaramaiah Arogya Marga.
  • Opposition parties, particularly the Janata Dal (Secular), condemned the move due to allegations against Siddaramaiah related to the MUDA scam.
  • Public suggestions for the renaming were invited by the civic body, which has faced accusations of lacking an elected board.
  • Political debates surrounding the MUDA scam have intensified, leading to accusations between parties in the assembly.
“The accused A1 Siddaramaiah, who illegally obtained a site in MUDA and cheated, is facing trial in the court and Lokayukta,” said a statement from the JDS.

The decision to rename the road has ignited significant political discussion, highlighting tensions between the ruling party and the Opposition over ongoing investigations and governance issues.

item.title: Delhi govt departments distance themselves from AAP’s promised schemes; ask people not to share personal details - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Government Disassociates from AAP's Promised Welfare Schemes

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Delhi government has distanced its departments from the Aam Aadmi Party's welfare schemes, warning citizens against sharing personal information for non-existent programs ahead of the upcoming Assembly polls.

  • The Women and Child Development and Health departments issued public notices clarifying that they do not recognize the AAP's proposed ₹2,100 monthly aid to women and the free treatment scheme for elderly citizens.
  • Citizens were cautioned against fraudulent activities involving collection of personal data under these schemes.
  • Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal expressed anger over the opposition's claims, alleging a coordinated effort to undermine the welfare programs.
  • The announcements were part of AAP's campaign strategy aimed at appealing to voters in the lead-up to elections in February.
  • Notices from the government reiterated that no authorized schemes were currently available for registration, urging caution in sharing personal details.
“Any private individual/political party collecting such physical forms/applications or collecting information of applicants under the name of 'Mukhyamantri Mahila Samman Yojana' is fraudulent and without any authority.”

In light of the new developments, the AAP faces significant challenges in sustaining its voter outreach efforts as the election date approaches.

item.title: PM Narendra Modi To Inaugurate Ken-Betwa River Link Project On December 25 - Free Press Journal
item.description:
PM Narendra Modi To Inaugurate Ken-Betwa River Link Project On December 25

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Not specified

Introduction: On the birth anniversary of former PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee, PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Ken-Betwa river link project on December 25 in Khajuraho.

  • The project aims to construct Daudhan dam on the borders of Chhatarpur and Panna, potentially named 'Atal Sagar Dam.'
  • It is the largest irrigation project in India, using an underground pressurized pipe system.
  • The dam will have a storage capacity of 2,853 million cubic meters.
  • A 221-km long link canal will transfer surplus water from the Ken river to the Betwa river.
  • The project will irrigate 8.11 lakh hectares across 2k villages in 10 districts, benefiting around 7 lakh farmer families.
“Around 7 lakh farmer families will be benefited by this project.”

Conclusion: The Ken-Betwa river link project is expected to significantly enhance irrigation and drinking water facilities in Madhya Pradesh, marking a step towards improved agricultural productivity.

item.title: Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Student sexually assaulted by 2 inside Chennai's Anna University campus

Published Date: 25 December 2024, Source: Chennai News

The incident involved a 19-year-old engineering student who was sexually assaulted on the Anna University campus in Chennai, sparking outrage across the state.

  • The assault occurred on December 23, with the victim reporting it to the police on December 24.
  • The male friend of the victim was attacked by two unidentified men, allowing the assailants to drag the girl into bushes.
  • The Kotturpuram Police have initiated a case under relevant sections concerning sexual offenses.
  • A special police team is working to identify and apprehend the suspects using CCTV footage.
  • Political leaders have condemned the incident, blaming the government for failing to ensure law and order.
“Women don’t feel safe in the State anymore, as the Police are kept busy by the ruling administration.” - K Annamalai, Tamil Nadu BJP Chief

The incident has raised serious concerns about safety in educational institutions and the government's response to such crimes.

item.title: UK reacts to Punjab Police claims on British soldier’s terror activities - Hindustan Times
item.description:
UK Responds to Punjab Police Allegations of British Soldier's Involvement in Terrorism

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The UK has denied allegations made by Punjab Police regarding a British Army soldier, Jagjeet Singh, being involved in terrorist activities within India.

  • The UK Ministry of Defence stated that there is no record of a soldier by that name currently serving in the British Army.
  • Punjab Police claimed Singh was part of a terror module under the Khalistan Zindabad Force, targeting religious leaders.
  • Singh’s name appeared in multiple investigations related to terrorism dating back to 2011.
  • The UK has stated that they had no prior communication from Indian authorities regarding Singh's involvement.
“Any investigations into criminal or terrorist activity in India are a matter for the Indian civil and military authorities.” - Rhian Shillabeer, UK Ministry of Defence

The situation underscores ongoing tensions over allegations of terrorism linked to the Sikh diaspora and the complexities of international collaboration on security matters.

item.title: 'They have planned to arrest Atishi': Kejriwal responds to BJP's criticism on AAP's welfare schemes - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal Responds to BJP's Criticism on AAP's Welfare Schemes

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: Not Provided

The article discusses Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's remarks in response to criticisms from the BJP regarding the Aam Aadmi Party's welfare schemes, particularly focusing on political tensions and allegations of arrest plans.

  • Kejriwal addresses the BJP's claims about AAP's welfare initiatives.
  • He suggests that the BJP has planned to arrest AAP leaders like Atishi.
  • The response indicates the ongoing political rivalry between AAP and BJP.
"They have planned to arrest Atishi" - Arvind Kejriwal

This statement reflects the escalating political tensions and the ongoing debate surrounding the effectiveness of welfare programs in Delhi.

item.title: ‘If India doesn’t respond in time…’: Bangladesh’s Yunus presses for Hasina’s extradition - Firstpost
item.description:
‘If India doesn’t respond in time…’: Bangladesh’s Yunus presses for Hasina’s extradition

Date: December 24, 2023 | Source: Firstpost

The interim government of Bangladesh, led by Muhammad Yunus, has requested India's extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, stating they will wait for a formal response before escalating the request.

  • Bangladesh sent a diplomatic note to India seeking Hasina's extradition for judicial proceedings.
  • Under the 2013 extradition treaty, Bangladesh argues for her return, citing various charges against her.
  • If India does not respond within what Bangladesh calls ‘natural time’, they will follow up with a note of urgency.
  • Hasina is accused of serious charges, including murder and crimes against humanity related to protests earlier this year.
  • Yunus’ interim government has been proactive in seeking Hasina's return since taking office in August.
“We informed the Indian government through a Note Verbale that we want her (Hasina) back for the judicial process.” - Touhid Hossain, advisor on foreign affairs

The Yunus administration stresses the importance of timely communication with India regarding this sensitive diplomatic matter.

item.title: ‘Fraudulent…without any authority’: Delhi departments issue public notices against 2 AAP schemes - The Indian Express
item.description:
Delhi Govt Disowns AAP's Newly Launched Schemes: A Controversial Move

Publication Date: December 25, 2024   Source: Indian Express

In an unprecedented move, senior officers in the Delhi government have released public notices disowning the registration process initiated by Chief Minister Atishi and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for two AAP schemes.

  • The disowned schemes include a monthly payment of Rs 2,100 to non-tax paying women and free healthcare for those over 60.
  • Notices highlight the lack of official notification for these schemes, labeling them as fraudulent.
  • The AAP and opposition leaders have exchanged accusations regarding these disowned schemes.
“The general public are hereby advised and requested not to entertain such promises of a non-existent scheme, as these are misleading and without any authority.”

In summary, this controversy sheds light on the rift between the Delhi government and its bureaucracy, raising questions about scheme implementations and the political implications for AAP.

item.title: ED probes Canadian colleges for alleged involvement in trafficking Indians to US - The Times of India
item.description:
ED probes Canadian colleges for alleged involvement in trafficking Indians to US

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Indian Enforcement Directorate has launched investigations into a number of Canadian colleges for their purported role in trafficking Indian students to the US.

  • Investigation focused on several colleges.
  • Allegations include exploitation of student immigration regulations.
  • Implications for both Canadian and Indian governments.
“The welfare of students is paramount in these investigations.”

This inquiry highlights ongoing concerns about the safety and regulation of international students.

item.title: PM Modi pens article on Atal Bihari Vajpayee on 100th birth anniversary: ‘Wasn't one to cling on to power’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi pens article on Atal Bihari Vajpayee on 100th birth anniversary: ‘Wasn't one to cling on to power’

Date: Wednesday
Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid homage to Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his 100th birth anniversary, highlighting his pivotal role in India's progression into the 21st century and his impact on the country's economic rise.

  • Modi described Vajpayee as a statesman who inspired many and emphasized his principled stance on power.
  • He noted Vajpayee's remarkable leadership during the 1998 Pokhran nuclear tests as emblematic of India's scientific capability and leadership.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's refusal to cling to power, recounting his resignation in 1996 rather than engaging in unethical politics.
  • Modi highlighted Vajpayee's commitment to the Constitution and his significant contributions to India's technological advancement.
“He stands tall as a statesman who continues to inspire countless people,” - PM Modi

In conclusion, Prime Minister Modi's article is a heartfelt tribute to Atal Bihari Vajpayee, reflecting on his values, vision for India, and lasting legacy in the country.

item.title: Canadian colleges under ED's scanner for illegally trafficking Indians into US - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Canadian Colleges Investigated for Trafficking Indians into the US

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated an investigation into several Indian individuals, entities, and Canadian colleges for allegedly trafficking Indians into the United States via Canada. This probe follows the tragic death of a family from Gujarat who succumbed to extreme cold while attempting to cross the border illegally in 2022.

  • The ED conducted raids at 8 locations in Mumbai, Nagpur, Gandhinagar, and Vadodara linked to the case.
  • Individuals, including Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel, are accused of orchestrating the trafficking under the guise of college admissions.
  • Victims were reportedly charged between ₹55 and ₹60 lakh for the illegal journey.
  • Over 25,000 students are referred to foreign colleges annually by associated entities.
  • 112 colleges in Canada might be involved in these illegal activities.
"ED initiated the investigation on the basis of an FIR registered by DCB, Crime Branch, Ahmedabad City, Gujarat against Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel after a family of 04 Indian nationals was found dead on the Canada-US Border."

This investigation highlights significant human trafficking issues and raises concerns on the vulnerability of individuals seeking better opportunities abroad.

item.title: 'Path Of Peace, Prosperity': PM Modi, President Murmu Extend Christmas Greetings To Nation - News18
item.description:
PM Modi and President Murmu Extend Christmas Greetings

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu extended Christmas greetings to the nation, highlighting the importance of love, kindness, and unity in society.

  • PM Modi emphasized spreading happiness and prosperity during his Christmas message.
  • President Murmu called for promoting equality and fostering unity during the festive season.
  • Midnight masses were held across Goa, celebrating the birth of Jesus with prayers and carols.
  • The celebrations in Goa attracted thousands of devotees and marked the start of the New Year season for tourists.

“Wishing you all a Merry Christmas. May the teachings of Lord Jesus Christ show everyone the path of peace and prosperity.” - PM Modi

“This special day reminds us of Jesus Christ’s timeless teachings of love, kindness, and compassion.” - President Murmu

The Christmas celebrations reflect a spirit of togetherness and joy across the nation.

item.title: Kerala Lottery Results 25.12.2024: Fifty Fifty FF-122 Winners Declared; Full List Here! - News18
item.description:
Kerala Lottery Results: Fifty Fifty FF-122 Winners Declared

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: News18

The Kerala State Lottery Department has announced the results for the Fifty Fifty-FF-122 lottery on December 25. The winner of the first prize will receive Rs. 1 crore, and the second and third prizes are Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 5,000 respectively.

Key Points:

  • 1st Prize: Rs 1 Crore
  • 2nd Prize: Rs 10 Lakh
  • 3rd Prize: Rs 5,000
  • Consolation Prize: Rs 8,000

[First Prize Winning Number: FX 105427 (NEYYATTINKARA)]

Visit the official Kerala Lottery website to verify results and for detailed instructions on claiming prizes.

item.title: "Stands Tall As A Statesman": PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee - NDTV
item.description:
PM Modi Remembers Atal Bihari Vajpayee on His Birth Centenary

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Prime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his birth centenary, highlighting his contributions to India's political stability and development.

  • Atal Bihari Vajpayee is celebrated as a statesman who inspired many.
  • Modi emphasized Vajpayee's role in transforming India into the 21st century.
  • Notable achievements during Vajpayee's tenure included advancements in IT and telecommunications.
  • The Golden Quadrilateral Project was highlighted as a significant infrastructure achievement.
  • Vajpayee's government initiated the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan to promote education accessibility.
  • Modi praised Vajpayee's leadership during the nuclear tests in Pokhran in 1998.
  • Vajpayee was recognized for his commitment to protecting the Constitution and democratic values.
  • His contributions to Indian culture and literature were acknowledged, showcasing his poetic talent.
“Atal Ji’s unwavering belief in the potential of our nation continues to inspire us to aim higher and work harder.” - PM Narendra Modi

In conclusion, PM Modi called for a dedication to fulfill Vajpayee's ideals and visions for India's future.

item.title: Delhi airport issues advisory as flights may get affected amid dense fog; GRAP 4 lifted as AQI improves - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Airport Advisory Due to Dense Fog as GRAP 4 Measures Lifted

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Indira Gandhi International Airport issued an advisory due to dense fog conditions affecting flight schedules and train services in Delhi. The Central government's GRAP 4 measures were lifted following an improvement in air quality.

  • Dense fog enveloped parts of Delhi, leading to flight disruptions.
  • At least 20 trains were reported running late due to the fog.
  • The overall minimum temperature in Delhi fell to 9°C on Wednesday.
  • GRAP 4 measures were lifted as air quality improved to 'Very Poor' (AQI 333).
  • Future weather forecasts indicate a potential drop in temperature and the possibility of light rain or snowfall.
“The improvement in air quality was attributed to favourable meteorological conditions, including improved wind speed.”

In conclusion, the dense fog has raised concerns for travelers, while the lifting of GRAP 4 measures reflects some progress in air quality management in the region.

item.title: IIM Calcutta MBA Admission: From CAT score to selection process, all you need to know before applying - Hindustan Times
item.description:
IIM Calcutta MBA Admission: Everything You Need to Know for 2025-27

Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

IIM Calcutta has released its MBA admission policy for the 2025-27 cycle, outlining the eligibility criteria and selection process for candidates.

Key Points:

  • A valid Common Admission Test (CAT) score is mandatory for all applicants.
  • Eligibility criteria include a bachelor's degree with a minimum percentage of marks (50% for general, 45% for SC/ST/PwD).
  • Two-stage selection process: initial shortlist based on CAT percentiles followed by personal interviews and written ability tests.
  • The selection criteria weigh CAT score, academic performance, and diversity factors.

Notable Quotes:

IIM Calcutta mentioned that the actual section-wise and overall percentile cut-offs may be much higher than the minimum percentiles depending upon the number of candidates called for personal interview (PI).

For detailed admissions information, candidates can visit the official website.

item.title: Orthodox bishop hits out at PM Modi over Christmas event - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Orthodox Bishop Criticizes PM Modi Over Christmas Celebrations

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A senior bishop of the Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church in Kerala criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in a social media post ahead of Christmas, sparking controversy regarding the BJP's outreach to the Christian community.

  • The bishop remarked on social media about the government's treatment of Christmas celebrations, referencing disruptions in Kerala.
  • The Christmas event in Delhi was attended by PM Modi as the chief guest, which the bishop saw as hypocritical.
  • During the Christmas season, BJP leaders are attempting to build relationships with the Christian community as part of a strategic outreach in Kerala.
  • Congress MP KC Venugopal criticized PM Modi for his silence on Christmas celebrations in Manipur, contrasting it with his comments on events in Germany.
  • BJP state president K Surendran condemned disruptions to Christmas celebrations in Kerala and called for a thorough investigation into the incidents.
“I see the Delhi event (of the CBCI) as a drama.” - Orthodox Bishop Yuhanon Meletius

This controversy highlights the complex relationship between the BJP and the Christian community, especially in light of recent events regarding Christmas celebrations in Kerala.
